data_dir= "dat" batch_size=1024 num_workers= 0 sample_uniform_slate=False valid_pct= 0.05 test_pct= 0.05 t_testsplit= 5

logging.info('Load data..') with np.load("{}/data.npz".format(data_dir)) as data_np: data = {key: torch.tensor(val) for key, val in data_np.items()}

with open('{}/ind2val.json'.format(data_dir), 'rb') as handle:

# Use string2int object_hook found here: https://stackoverflow.com/a/54112705
ind2val = json.load(
    handle, 
    object_hook=lambda d: {
        int(k) if k.lstrip('-').isdigit() else k: v 
        for k, v in d.items()
        }
    )
{% raw %}

load_dataloaders[source]

load_dataloaders(data_dir='dat', batch_size=1024, num_workers=0, sample_uniform_slate=False, valid_pct=0.05, test_pct=0.05, t_testsplit=5)

Loads pytorch dataloaders to be used in training. If used with standard settings, the train/val/test split is equivalent to Eide et. al. 2021

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

ind2val, itemattr, dataloaders = load_dataloaders()
